body: It's sad, the vigil. More so because r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should care and doesn't, than any grief for m_c.
r_c refuses to sit vigil for m_c. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} failed r_c as a parent, guardian, and mentor. Why should r_c honor {PRONOUN/m_c/object} now?
r_c is called to m_c's vigil, but declines to speak. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} not sure {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'d have anything good to say.
They may have shared blood, but nothing more. r_c doesn't show up to m_c's vigil.

body: Even as r_c is surrounded by cats mourning m_c, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} it hard to care.
The only reason r_c sits vigil is because of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} dedication to the Warrior Code and StarClan, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} could care less about m_c.
r_c holds back all {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} words about m_c's failures as a parent. It's not done to speak ill of the dead.
